intro: Hieracium eriotrichum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, bristly seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium eriotrichum is often found in temperate climates and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
